image.altText: Soldiers standing near a fenced zone

props.synopsis: Israel's military says it is conducting strikes on "terror" targets in Lebanon after armed group Hezbollah accused it of breaching a ceasefire that took hold last week.

title.children: Israel claims it is 'enforcing' ceasefire as IDF strikes targets in Lebanon

image.altText: Footprints and tools can be seen on a floor covered in white dust.

props.synopsis: Former stonemason Joshua Bucklow has silicosis. His lawyer says his fight for compensation is being dragged out because Israel-based Caesarstone is hiding behind the war in Gaza.

title.children: Caesarstone alleged to be hiding behind war in Gaza to delay potential silicosis compensation payout in Australia

image.altText: Joe Biden wears a white jacket with an American flag on the sleeve and walks with Hunter in front of a leafy background.

props.synopsis: It sounds like a parlour game moral dilemma. But if you're the most powerful man in the world, 82 years old and about to retire, why not save your surviving son from a possible prison sentence?

title.children: Biden's decision on a moral dilemma could have far-reaching fallout under Trump

image.altText: Sexting

props.synopsis: A brand new register designed to crackdown on SMS scams has been announced by the government. Follow live.

title.children: Telcos required to block scam texts under government crackdown

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Tech giants pushback on social media ban 'not surprising': PM
Pocock says he 'certainly' thought a deal was reached on nature positive
Army chief says he's prepared to boot sex offenders from the military

image.altText: A close-up of an Australian Army patch and an Australian flag patch on an ADF officer's uniform.

props.synopsis: The royal commission uncovered "extensive" evidence of sexual assaults within Defence.

title.children: 'Ridiculously overdue': Advocates respond to promise to act on sexual violence in ADF

image.altText: A man in a light blue singlet sitting in front of plants.

props.synopsis: Perry Kouroumblis, who is wanted wanted over Melbourne's 1977 Easey Street murders, is expected to arrive back in the city on Tuesday evening, after being extradited from Italy.

title.children: Suspect in Victoria's 1977 Easey Street murders extradited from Italy

image.altText: A red sign on the door warning of child abuse material.

props.synopsis: 7.30 has been given a rare glimpse inside the AFP's Child Protection Triage Unit, where investigators often confront the worst examples of child exploitation.

title.children: 'Not everyone can do it': Behind this door, AFP officers are exposed to the worst of humanity

props.synopsis: The Australian facial injectables industry was estimated to be worth $4.1 billion in 2023, with big corporates including Wesfarmers owning a slice of the market. But the business model behind the boom has attracted complaints and raised some safety concerns.

title.children: A business model called 'scripting' has seen cosmetic injectables boom, but it's not without risk

image.altText: A composite image of a man in a suit and a woman wearing glasses.

props.synopsis: The federal government is attempting to spruik its economic management just as the Reserve Bank is digging its heels in over inflation. With an election months away, it doesn't bode well for Labor.

title.children: The RBA is holding firm on future interest rate cuts. It doesn't bode well ahead of an election

image.altText: A barista holding a silver milk jug  and a white cup full of coffee, pouring the milk into the coffee to make latte art

props.synopsis: A Business Council ranking of states and territories has crowned South Australia the best place in the country to run a business and labelled Victoria the worst. It could spur a debate inside Labor about whether the state is beginning to hurt Anthony Albanese's election chances.

title.children: Victoria named worst state to open new cafe as Labor debates brand damage in Albanese stronghold

image.altText: A man in a crowd waving a black, white and green flag in front of an ancient fort with damaged buildings in the background

props.synopsis: The decapitation and capitulation of Hezbollah in Lebanon after an Israeli onslaught has rippled across the border to the protracted Syrian civil war, reigniting an even more complex and devastating conflict.

title.children: With Putin busy in Ukraine, and Hezbollah tied up with Israel, someone forgot to check in on Syria

image.altText: A graphic of a speed limit for a 90kph zone.

props.synopsis: Driving in later life can bring its own challenges, and while rules around older road users vary widely across the country, options for navigating those challenges include licence assessments and conversations around so-called "driving retirement".

title.children: There are speed limits on the roads — but should there be age limits?

image.altText: Achieving their dream of home ownership through hard work and dedication

props.synopsis: Meatworkers Jordan Cullinane, 23, and Remi Krahenbring, 25, knew they didn't want to be paying off someone else's mortgage, so they put their heads down and started saving.

title.children: 'We saved for this': Young couple crack housing dream

image.altText: Two men embrace in an office.

props.synopsis: Before leaving the White House in January, President Joe Biden will provide Ukraine with military aid to bolster the government in Kyiv in its war with Russia.

title.children: US to send Stinger missiles and landmines to Ukraine in $1.1 billion weapons package for Kyiv's war with Russia

image.altText: People hold Taiwanese flags during a parade

props.synopsis: The head of federal parliament's intelligence committee has suggested Australia is bolstering its military capabilities in part to deter China from invading Taiwan.

title.children: Australian senator says China went 'berserk' over Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: Wall Street indices have been mixed overnight, with the ASX 200 set to head up from last night's record close. Follow the day's events and insights on our live business blog.

title.children: Wall Street mixed but ASX 200 set to head up from record close

image.altText: A large satellite dish points towards the sky.

props.synopsis: Carnarvon's enormous satellite dish is a step closer to being back in action amid a global space and technology boom.

title.children: NASA dish in remote WA receives first signal in more than four decades

image.altText: A man with curly brown hair smiles at the camera. He uses crutches to stand in the beautiful bushland scene behind him.

props.synopsis: Marcus Dadd says working at the remote Delamere Station has been an "incredible experience" and believes there's a place for people with disability in the beef industry.

title.children: Disability ambassador working on remote cattle station hopes to inspire others to chase their dream

image.altText: The back of an ambulance displaying a warning to people to give paramedics 'space to save lives'

props.synopsis: A leaked review into St John Ambulance NT has revealed "serious" concerns about clinical governance within the private service, finding some processes may have led to patient deaths and "significant risk" to staff.

title.children: NT's ambulance contract in doubt after damning report finds 'unacceptably high level of risk'

image.altText: Baby Kobi sits against a white background smiling wearing a white shirt and flowery pants

props.synopsis: The "main issue" for police handling domestic violence matters is finding a way to encourage coercive control victims to confide in them when non-contact orders have been breached, a senior police officer has told the inquest into the murder-suicide of Kobi and Henry Shepherdson.

title.children: Senior police officer tells inquest DV victims must be encouraged to report non-contact breaches

image.altText: Man wearing a suit with a red tie.

props.synopsis: A Liberal National Party MP has told federal parliament "you cannot possibly compare" women who work in childcare with men who work in construction during a debate about gender pay equity.

title.children: 'Many women don't want to be CEOs': Coalition MP criticised over gender pay gap comments

image.altText: Image of Venus's clouds taken by the Akatsuki spacecraft.

props.synopsis: Venus was once covered in water. Or was it? An analysis of our twin planet’s atmosphere suggests it could never have supported life.

title.children: Scientists thought Venus was once like Earth. A new study suggests it never had water

image.altText: A close up of a koala eating leaves.

props.synopsis: Researchers from the University of Sydney undertook the task in the wake of the Black Summer bushfires, when they found there was a lack of data to be able to quantify the loss to the koala population.

title.children: The '3-billion-piece puzzle' researchers hope will help save koalas from extinction

image.altText: A banner at a Roma game reads FORZA EDO

props.synopsis: Fiorentina says Edoardo Bove is out of a coma, awake and alert after collapsing on the pitch during a game against Inter Milan.

title.children: Edoardo Bove 'awake and alert' after collapsing during Serie A game

image.altText: A red Australia Post electric sign

props.synopsis: Start wrapping gifts and licking envelopes, Australia Post has put out deadlines for domestic and international mail this Christmas period.

title.children: Make sure you send your Christmas parcels and cards on time with this guide to cut-off dates

image.altText: close up of stone pub called the Parkside Hotel

props.synopsis: A national company appears to walk back a reported notice to venue managers about celebrating Australia Day on January 26, saying in a statement its comments caused "concern and confusion".

title.children: Hospitality group apologises after reportedly telling pubs not to celebrate Australia Day

image.altText: Cortnee Vine of Australia celebrates with teammates after kicking a successful penalty goal

props.synopsis: Analysis by the Victorian government shows the Matildas were the subject of one in five sports news stories published across the state during the tournament, but there's still a long way to go to achieve gender balance.

title.children: Matildas the catalyst for major exposure of women's sport, but still plenty of room for improvement

image.altText: Lando Norris has wine poured on him by Charles Leclerc and Max Verstappen on the F1 podium.

props.synopsis: F1 has had a drivers' and constructors' championships for the past 67 years and they usually go to the same team, but there are exceptions.

title.children: F1 has two world championships and just like 2024, they do not always go to the same team

image.altText: An 80-year-old woman with short grey hair and a navy top, standing with her arms crossed, a green monstera in the foreground

props.synopsis: The acclaimed author of Monkey Grip and The Children's Bach is back: this time she turns her razor-sharp writer's eye to her 16-year-old grandson's footy team.

title.children: Helen Garner's new book uses footy to sketch a tender portrait of teenage boys

image.altText: People running out onto a street.

props.synopsis: The stampede broke out on Sunday afternoon at the stadium in the city of Nzerekore during the final of a local tournament.

title.children: More than 50 people killed in stampede following clashes at a Guinea soccer match

image.altText: Jordan Thompson speaks to Lleyton Hewitt courtside while looking frustrated

props.synopsis: Lleyton Hewitt's Australian team will meet old foes Sweden, away, then face Belgium or Chile, in the qualifying rounds for the Davis Cup final 8.

title.children: Difficult draw and former superpowers await Australia in Davis Cup

image.altText: A large water filtration system being constructed outside one a concrete slab.

props.synopsis: The $3.5-million upgrade to the Cascade filtration plant will help make drinking water safe again for thousands of residents after PFAS was found in two dams supplying water to the plant.

title.children: Mobile treatment system installed to remove cancer-linked 'forever chemicals' from Blue Mountains drinking water

image.altText: Close-up of a man and woman wearing American pioneer clothing sit near a tree and a rock.

props.synopsis: The Lord of the Rings star Viggo Mortensen brings rom-com energy to this frontier story co-starring Phantom Threads actor Vicky Krieps.

title.children: The Dead Don't Hurt is a western, but not the one you're expecting
